description: From Middle English cok crowe (also as cokkes crowe), equivalent to cock +‎ crow. Likely a suppletive variation of Old English hancrǣd (“cockcrow, dawn”, literally “cock-crowing”), from hana (“cock, rooster”) + crǣd (“crowing”).

entries.meaning: The time of day at which the first crow of a cockerel is heard; dawn or daybreak; first light
